summary: This is an email from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York, dated June 12, 2019. It discusses a victim's bank records showing cash deposits from Jeffrey Epstein, which are used to establish a timeline for the abuse, beginning shortly after her 16th birthday and continuing until before her 18th birthday.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The source of cash deposited into a victim's bank account, with the timeline of deposits used to establish the period of abuse.

events.title: AUSA Email Regarding Victim's Financial Records
events.description: An Assistant United States Attorney sends an email discussing a victim's bank records showing cash deposits from Jeffrey Epstein, which are used to establish the timeline of abuse.

keyFacts: A victim would typically deposit cash from Jeffrey Epstein into her bank account immediately.
Bank records provided by the victim show the abuse began no later than June, just weeks after her 16th birthday.
The abuse continued through at least January, several months before her 18th birthday.
The document is correspondence from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York, dated June 12, 2019.
Financial records (bank deposits) are being used as evidence to establish the timeline of the criminal activity.
